title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots may cut Stefon Diggs, saving $16.8 million, due to legal issues despite his $20 million base salary.
DeMario Douglas, Mack Hollins, Kayshon Boutte could be cut or traded to create cap space for 2026 season.
Christian Elliss might be released from linebacker group, saving New England a few million in cap space.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not return for the Celtics' game against the 76ers due to a right Achilles injury.
Philadelphia's Joel Embiid will miss Sunday's game with an oblique strain, expected to miss three more games.
The Celtics have a 1-2 record against the 76ers this season, with each game decided by two points or less.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hit three home runs during the first week of Red Sox spring training, including two against left-handed pitchers.
Duran's performance includes a 7-for-12 batting average and positions him as a potential candidate for the third spot in the lineup.
Despite 2025 struggles, Duran could be considered for the designated hitter role due to his improved spring training performance.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have scored a combined 39 goals this season for Boston College's hockey team.
The Bruins' prospect pool shows improvement with notable performances from Hagens and Letourneau at BC.
The Bruins are performing well under coach Marco Sturm, with a record of 13-2-3 since Dec. 31, 2025.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Celtics are in second place, 5.5 games behind the Pistons in the Eastern Conference standings.
An NBA assistant coach views the Boston Celtics as the favorites to win the Eastern Conference this season.
Jayson Tatum's potential return could give Boston four superior scorers compared to Detroit's playmakers.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at Boston's Boch Center Wang Theatre on February 27, showcasing a diverse setlist.
The band played hits like 'Cover Me Up' and covered songs from The Rolling Stones and Drive-By Truckers.
Isbell switched between electric and acoustic guitars, highlighting themes of Americana and personal storytelling.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots aren't expected to sign top edge rushers like Trey Hendrickson or Jaelan Phillips due to high costs.
Raiders likely to retain Maxx Crosby, asking for two first-round picks; no trade forthcoming before the NFL Draft.
Patriots might address edge rusher need through the deep 2026 draft class, eyeing Missouri's Zion Young as a candidate.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount's purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion awaits regulatory approval, potentially integrating CBS with TNT/TBS.
The deal could lead to increased collaboration between CBS and Warner Bros. Discovery on sports broadcasts like MLB and NHL.
Netflix, not purchasing Warner Bros. Discovery, may focus on acquiring NFL streaming rights when current deals end after 2029.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are interested in acquiring Eagles' wide receiver A.J. Brown but find the asking price too high.
Philadelphia may trade Brown for a package similar to D.K. Metcalf's trade, potentially involving early draft picks.
Trading Brown could financially burden the Eagles, costing them up to $44 million in dead money if done before June 1.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts will switch from E-ZPass transponders to windshield sticker tags starting Sunday, utilizing RFID technology for toll reading.
Sticker tags, provided free of charge, will replace $6.70 transponders, saving the state approximately $7.4 million annually.
Existing transponders remain functional; stickers offer a cost-effective, no-fee replacement option for Massachusetts drivers.
